definitions.definition: a baked dish of fruit or meat and/or vegetables with pastry on the bottom, sides and top

examples.text: Help yourself to some more pie.
What’s the filling in these pies?

definitions.definition: used to say that something is typical of America

examples.text: The whole procedure is as easy as ABC.
Fooling him was as easy as falling off a log.

definitions.definition: very kind and friendly, especially when you are not expecting it
to say and show that you are sorry for a mistake that you made
to be involved in a lot of different activities and have influence over them, especially when other people think that this is annoying
a share of the available money or benefits that you believe you have a right to

examples.text: The company is demanding a larger slice of the corporate pie.

definitions.definition: an event that somebody talks about that seems very unlikely to happen

examples.text: This talk of moving to Australia is all just pie in the sky.

wordOrigin: Middle English: probably the same word as pie, used in the naming of birds; the various combinations of ingredients being compared to objects randomly collected by a magpie.
